page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content:
Ashford has always been an important 'railway' town. It has two routes cutting across our survey area.
Line one cuts through the village of Sevington and is on the main route from London to the Channel Ports of Dover and Folkestone. This line is very busy with through Port Traffic and also has two trains per hour at normal times with extra during 'rush' hour times for the commuter traffic, London being 1 hour, by fast train, away. Line two is based on the Ashford/Hastings route and almost bisects the 'Block' in two.
